title: The City of Dreams
description: Navigate the bustling streets of Mumbai, from colonial architecture to iconic street food, discovering the resilience and glamour of India's financial capital.

steps.title: Gateway of India
steps.description: An arch-monument built in the 20th century to commemorate the landing of King-Emperor George V and Queen-Empress Mary.
steps.clue: I stand guard at the water's edge, the first thing visitors saw when arriving by steamship.
steps.mustTry: Take a photo with the pigeons and the Taj Hotel in the background.

steps.title: Leopold Cafe
steps.description: A popular restaurant and bar founded in 1871, famous for its history and literary mentions.
steps.clue: Bullet holes from a dark day remain on my walls, but my spirit and beer towers stand tall.
steps.mustTry: Order the Roast Chicken and a Cold Coffee.

steps.title: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus
steps.description: A historic railway station and UNESCO World Heritage Site exhibiting Victorian Gothic Revival architecture.
steps.clue: I am a palace for trains, where gargoyles watch over millions of commuters every day.
steps.mustTry: Admire the starry ceiling inside the ticket hall.

steps.title: Marine Drive
steps.description: A 3.6-kilometre-long boulevard famously known as the Queen's Necklace.
steps.clue: I curve along the sea, glowing like a string of pearls at night.
steps.mustTry: Sit on the promenade and watch the sunset.

steps.title: Kyani & Co.
steps.description: One of the oldest operating Parsi cafes in Mumbai, known for its old-world charm.
steps.clue: Chequered tablecloths, bentwood chairs, and the smell of freshly baked bun maska define me.
steps.mustTry: Bun Maska and Irani Chai.

steps.title: Mani Bhavan
steps.description: A museum and historical building dedicated to Gandhi, who stayed here during his visits to Mumbai.
steps.clue: Find the quiet house where the Mahatma planned freedom movements and learned to use the charkha.
steps.mustTry: View the doll dioramas depicting Gandhi's life.

steps.title: Haji Ali Dargah
steps.description: A mosque and tomb located on an islet off the coast of Worli.
steps.clue: I float on the sea, accessible only by a narrow path that disappears during high tide.
steps.mustTry: Listen to the Qawwali singers if present.

steps.title: Dhobi Ghat
steps.description: The world's largest open-air laundry, showcasing a unique aspect of Mumbai's daily life.
steps.clue: Thousands of clothes are flogged on stones here, creating a colorful mosaic visible from the bridge.
steps.mustTry: Watch the organized chaos from the viewing platform.

steps.title: Siddhivinayak Temple
steps.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shri Ganesh, frequented by Bollywood stars and politicians.
steps.clue: Devotees walk barefoot to see the remover of obstacles who grants wishes here.
steps.mustTry: Buy the Modak prasad.

steps.title: Bandstand Promenade
steps.description: A popular seafront walkway in Bandra, often associated with Bollywood stardom.
steps.clue: Walk past the 'Land's End' where the King of Bollywood waves to his fans.
steps.mustTry: Eat roasted corn (bhutta) by the sea.

title: Echoes of Empires
description: Traverse the layers of history in India's capital, from Mughal grandeur to colonial power and spicy street treats.

steps.title: India Gate
steps.description: A war memorial dedicated to 70,000 soldiers of the British Indian Army.
steps.clue: An eternal flame burns beneath my arch at the end of the Rajpath.
steps.mustTry: Enjoy an ice cream bar while walking the lawns.

steps.title: Jama Masjid
steps.description: One of the largest mosques in India, built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan.
steps.clue: Climb my southern minaret to see the Red Fort and the chaotic veins of Old Delhi.
steps.mustTry: Climb the minaret for a bird's eye view.

steps.title: Karim's
steps.description: A historic restaurant near Jama Masjid serving Mughal cuisine since 1913.
steps.clue: Hidden in a narrow alley near the great mosque, the aroma of seekh kebabs will guide you.
steps.mustTry: Mutton Korma and Khamiri Roti.

steps.title: Humayun's Tomb
steps.description: The tomb of the Mughal Emperor Humayun, the first garden-tomb on the Indian subcontinent.
steps.clue: I was the inspiration for the Taj Mahal, a red sandstone beauty in a Charbagh garden.
steps.mustTry: Walk through the water channels at sunset.

steps.title: Lodhi Gardens
steps.description: A city park spread over 90 acres, containing tombs of Mohammed Shah and Sikandar Lodi.
steps.clue: Joggers run past centuries-old domes in this green lung of the city.
steps.mustTry: Picnic near the Bada Gumbad.

steps.title: Gurudwara Bangla Sahib
steps.description: One of the most prominent Sikh gurdwaras, known for its association with the eighth Sikh Guru.
steps.clue: Look for the golden dome and the holy Sarovar water that heals.
steps.mustTry: Volunteer in the Langar (community kitchen) or eat the meal.

steps.title: Chandni Chowk
steps.description: One of the oldest and busiest markets in Old Delhi.
steps.clue: A maze of silver, spices, and sarees where rickshaws battle for space.
steps.mustTry: Eat Parathas at Paranthe Wali Gali.

steps.title: Qutub Minar
steps.description: A 73-metre tall tapering tower of five storeys, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
steps.clue: I am the tallest brick minaret in the world, surrounded by iron that never rusts.
steps.mustTry: Read the intricate calligraphy carved on the stone.

steps.title: Dilli Haat
steps.description: An open-air food plaza and craft bazaar.
steps.clue: A village market in the heart of the city where every state of India sells its art.
steps.mustTry: Try Momos from the Sikkim stall.

steps.title: Lotus Temple
steps.description: A Baháʼí House of Worship notable for its flower-like shape.
steps.clue: I am a white flower made of marble that welcomes all religions in silence.
steps.mustTry: Spend 10 minutes in absolute silence inside the hall.

title: Gardens & Bytes
description: Explore the Garden City's transformation from a pensioner's paradise to the Silicon Valley of India.

steps.title: Cubbon Park
steps.description: A landmark 'lung' area of the Bengaluru city.
steps.clue: A green expanse in the city center where red colonial buildings hide among the bamboo.
steps.mustTry: Take a photo of the State Central Library.

steps.title: Vidhana Soudha
steps.description: The seat of the state legislature of Karnataka, built in a Neo-Dravidian style.
steps.clue: I am the grand legislative seat with the slogan 'Government's Work is God's Work' inscribed on me.
steps.mustTry: View the building illuminated at night (Sundays/Holidays).

steps.title: MTR (Mavalli Tiffin Room)
steps.description: A legendary restaurant near Lalbagh, famous for inventing the Rava Idli.
steps.clue: We invented a new type of idli during World War II rice shortages. Find the original branch.
steps.mustTry: Rava Idli and Filter Coffee.

steps.title: Lalbagh Botanical Garden
steps.description: An old botanical garden commissioned by Hyder Ali in 1760.
steps.clue: Look for the giant glass house inspired by London's Crystal Palace.
steps.mustTry: Climb the peninsular gniess rock for a view.

steps.title: Bangalore Palace
steps.description: A palace built by the Wadiyars in Tudor Revival style.
steps.clue: I look like a castle from England, complete with turrets and ivy, but I reside in India.
steps.mustTry: Use the audio guide to learn about the royal family.

steps.title: Tipu Sultan's Summer Palace
steps.description: An example of Indo-Islamic architecture and was the summer residence of the Mysorean ruler Tipu Sultan.
steps.clue: A wooden structure entirely made of teak, known as the 'Abode of Happiness'.
steps.mustTry: Observe the floral frescoes on the walls.

steps.title: Corner House Ice Cream
steps.description: An iconic ice cream parlor chain started in the 80s.
steps.clue: The city's sweet tooth craves my 'Death by Chocolate'.
steps.mustTry: Order the DBC (Death by Chocolate).

steps.title: Bull Temple
steps.description: A temple in Basavanagudi known for its large statue of the sacred bull, Nandi.
steps.clue: A massive granite bull resides here, carved from a single rock.
steps.mustTry: Attend the groundnut fair (Kadalekai Parishe) if in season.

steps.title: Commercial Street
steps.description: A street famous for trade in clothes, footwear, jewelry, and electronics.
steps.clue: The ultimate test of your bargaining skills in a narrow, crowded shopping lane.
steps.mustTry: Shop for inexpensive trinkets and clothes.

steps.title: ISKCON Temple
steps.description: One of the largest ISKCON temples in the world.
steps.clue: A hill-top temple complex blending modern glass and traditional gopurams.
steps.mustTry: Taste the Khichdi prasadam.

title: The Pink City Royal Trail
description: Immerse yourself in the grandeur of Rajput royalty, vibrant bazaars, and architectural marvels.

steps.title: Hawa Mahal
steps.description: The 'Palace of Winds' constructed of red and pink sandstone.
steps.clue: I have 953 small windows (Jharokhas) so royal ladies could watch the street festivals unseen.
steps.mustTry: Take a photo from the cafe across the street.

steps.title: Amber Fort
steps.description: A majestic fort located high on a hill, known for its artistic style elements.
steps.clue: Ride an elephant or a jeep to reach my gates; look for the Sheesh Mahal (Mirror Palace) inside.
steps.mustTry: See the light and sound show in the evening.

steps.title: Jantar Mantar
steps.description: A collection of nineteen architectural astronomical instruments.
steps.clue: I am a playground of stone instruments used to read the stars and tell time to the second.
steps.mustTry: Locate the world's largest stone sundial.

steps.title: City Palace
steps.description: A palace complex that includes the Chandra Mahal and Mubarak Mahal.
steps.clue: The royal family still lives in part of me. Look for the four seasons gates.
steps.mustTry: See the two giant silver urns (Gangajalis).

steps.title: Lassiwala
steps.description: A famous eatery on MI Road known for its creamy Lassi.
steps.clue: They serve a thick, sweet drink in clay cups (kulhads) since 1944. Go early before they run out.
steps.mustTry: Large Sweet Lassi with extra malai.

steps.title: Nahargarh Fort
steps.description: Stand on the edge of the Aravalli hills for the best view of the city.
steps.clue: I am the Tiger Fort that watches over the Pink City from a high ridge.
steps.mustTry: Watch the sunset over Jaipur city.

steps.title: Johari Bazaar
steps.description: The jeweler's market of Jaipur.
steps.clue: If you seek gemstones, Kundan jewelry, or the perfect saree, walk this pink street.
steps.mustTry: Buy a traditional Bandhani dupatta.

steps.title: Rawat Misthan Bhandar
steps.description: A popular sweet shop famous for its Pyaaz Ki Kachori.
steps.clue: Famous for a spicy, deep-fried onion pastry that people line up for.
steps.mustTry: Pyaaz Ki Kachori.

steps.title: Albert Hall Museum
steps.description: The oldest museum of the state, functioning as the state museum of Rajasthan.
steps.clue: Hundreds of pigeons fly around this Indo-Saracenic building housing an Egyptian mummy.
steps.mustTry: Feed the pigeons outside.

steps.title: Jal Mahal
steps.description: A palace in the middle of the Man Sagar Lake.
steps.clue: I float in the lake, and four of my five floors are underwater.
steps.mustTry: Take a walk on the promenade facing the lake.

title: Susegad & Heritage
description: Discover the relaxed Goan way of life through Portuguese heritage, pristine nature, and coastal cuisine.

steps.title: Basilica of Bom Jesus
steps.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site containing the remains of St. Francis Xavier.
steps.clue: An un-plastered laterite church in Old Goa that holds the body of a Saint.
steps.mustTry: Observe the Baroque architecture of the main altar.

steps.title: Fontainhas
steps.description: The old Latin Quarter in Panjim.
steps.clue: Walk through narrow streets lined with brightly colored Portuguese houses in yellow, blue, and green.
steps.mustTry: Take photos by the colorful walls.

steps.title: Fort Aguada
steps.description: A well-preserved seventeenth-century Portuguese fort standing on Sinquerim Beach.
steps.clue: I have a lighthouse and a massive cistern that once supplied water to ships.
steps.mustTry: Visit the lighthouse for panoramic ocean views.

steps.title: Anjuna Flea Market
steps.description: A famous weekly market started by hippies in the 1960s.
steps.clue: Open only on Wednesdays, this chaotic market sells everything from spices to trance music.
steps.mustTry: Bargain for souvenirs.

steps.title: Viva Panjim
steps.description: A restaurant located in a heritage house in Fontainhas.
steps.clue: Dine in an ancestral home to taste authentic Goan curry.
steps.mustTry: Pork Vindaloo or Prawn Curry Rice.

steps.title: Chapora Fort
steps.description: A fort offering commanding views of the Vagator beach, famous from the movie 'Dil Chahta Hai'.
steps.clue: Sit on the walls where three friends sat in a famous Bollywood movie, overlooking the Vagator beach.
steps.mustTry: Watch the sunset from the fort walls.

steps.title: Fisherman's Wharf
steps.description: A restaurant by the river offering a mix of Goan zest and global cuisine.
steps.clue: Eat by the river Sal in the south, enjoying live music and seafood.
steps.mustTry: Goan Fish Curry and Bebinca.

steps.title: Se Cathedral
steps.description: The cathedral of the Latin Rite Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Goa and Daman.
steps.clue: I am larger than any church in Portugal, home to the 'Golden Bell'.
steps.mustTry: Listen for the sound of the bell.

steps.title: Palolem Beach
steps.description: A beautiful crescent-shaped beach in South Goa.
steps.clue: A crescent-shaped paradise in the south with calm waters and silent discos.
steps.mustTry: Take a boat ride to see dolphins.

steps.title: Mangeshi Temple
steps.description: A major Hindu temple in Ponda dedicated to Lord Shiva.
steps.clue: Look for the seven-story deepstambha (lamp tower) at this serene temple entrance.
steps.mustTry: Witness the lamp tower lit up (festivals).
